actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. With written report No. 100-568.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 1032.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Called up by House Under Suspension of Rules.
Passed House (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Message on House action received in Senate and held at desk: House amendment to Senate bill.
Senate agreed to the House amendment by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 100-633.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks and Forests

official_title: A bill to amend the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to designate a segment of the Rio Chama River in New Mexico as a component of the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System.

summary.text: (Measure passed House, amended) Amends the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to designate a segment of the Rio Chama River, New Mexico, as a component of the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System. Provides that nothing in this Act or the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act shall interfere with the Secretary of the Army's operation and management of the Abiquiu Dam in New Mexico.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to designate a segment of the Rio Chama River in New Mexico as a component of the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System.
